page.title: 11FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: The gently undulating terrain lends itself to succesful farming. Crops are oats, barley and wheat for harvest in July to August, followed by a catch crop of stubble turnips to feed sheep in early Spring when the large flocks from both estates are lambing. Some lambs are fattened and sent to slaughter. Others are sold as store lambs to be fattened elsewhere. Ewes are at the end of their commercial viability after 6 or 7 years. Shearing is done by contractors (often Australians or New Zealanders who travel around the country) during May and June. Dipping against sheep scab and maggots is compulsory in summer and autumn. A Ministry of Agriculture inspector should be present to verify the dipping is done correctly.
